intro: Psychotria dubia var. dubia, commonly known as the ghost plant or ghost flower, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, pale green leaves and delicate, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
